RT @chriscantino: Web3 is a decades-long journey

If you‚Äôre jumping at every opp that comes your way‚Äîevery dollar, every project, every par‚Ä¶

If you‚Äôre jumping at every opp that comes your way‚Äîevery dollar, every project, every partnership‚Ä¶ you‚Äôre boxing yourself in

Take the long road

Or you can just drop something people actually want

Flip an NFT

Invest in a web3 startup

Repeat

It‚Äôll simply be useful
@StarcatchersNFT ehhh.. was told i was on allow list tho not sure what's up https://t.co/fPipy6I3lE

When crypto is at its most accessible, users don‚Äôt even realize they‚Äôre engaging with the blockchain

Mainstream users don‚Äôt need to know much about Ethereum, zk-SNARKs, smart contracts, or even NFTs

They can receive most all benefits of the network without the complexity

There is no doubt that over the mid-term, we will take our share of losses.

There will be turbulence. There will be illiquidity.

But over a long time horizon, if NFTs continue to deliver innovation + utility, their growth is inevitable.

The market is shifting. Are you ready?

Market Clarification

-As awareness of scams, pumps, and paper-thin leadership increases, collectors become savvier and veer away from red flags
-Accounts and tools that vet projects gain popularity
-Speculative markets are increasingly clarified and balanced by participation

Alternative Chains and Transactional Frameworks

-Increased volume on L1s and L2s as collectors hedge overexposure to ETH
-Investors seek arbitrage on emerging chains similar to their ‚Äúearly days‚Äù in ETH
-Opportunity for both breakout performance and getting completely rekt

Leverage and Access

-The ‚Äúdefi-ization‚Äù of NFTs provides greater optionality through collateralization, fractionalization, and lending
-Overly-leveraged projects will bubble and pop
-Lowered barriers to ownership increases access to blue chips and strengthens communities

Utility

-Alpha community access becomes increasingly sought after and costly
-Communities that consistently provide alpha and receive allow list allocations for top projects effectively ‚Äúprint money‚Äù for members
-Gaming, land, defi, and access NFTs outperform relative to PFPs

New Projects

-Provide most affordable points of entry, with the highest risk/reward exposure
-Increasing number of illiquid projects; more bagholders
-Liquidity increasingly distributed
-Prevalence of pumping and ponzis
-Surge of experimentation, innovation and utility

Mid-tier Collections

-Projects between 2-6 ETH vie to become blue chips via partnerships, events, and world-building
-Appealing investment vehicles, as they have demonstrated product market fit but need $$$ to scale
-Provide high-growth exposure with less risk than new projects

Blue Chips

-Institutional money buys in to allocate exposure within ETH
-Asset class reinforced due to low supply, provenance, and ‚Äústore of value‚Äù designation within portfolios
-More blue chip collections arise
-Some market leaders decline when outperformed by emerging projects
What happens when mainstream money starts flowing into NFTs? üßµ

Invest on a long time horizon.

@Research4Nft @the_x2y2 @LooksRareNFT It‚Äôs just like Shopify.

Merchants provide buyers with better, curated experiences, and enjoy better margins.

Collectors also enjoy better margins (no % to OpenSea).

Projects can still choose to participate in distribution channels like OS in addition to their DTC marketplaces.

@srinathariharan @dennishegstad Novel, Flow, Bitski, Shopify itself.. yes

But also just open-sourced DIY options like Larva Labs https://t.co/h3Ox9Xy6je

NFT projects launching their own vertical marketplaces will be huge in 2022.

Provide your community with a curated DTC experience vs asking them to shop wholesale at OpenSea.

-Customize the user journey
-Improve retention
-Increase profit margins
-Minimize exploits

Go direct.
